meanings.definition: A manuscript volume, especially of a classic work or of the Scriptures.
meanings.sent1: The library contained ancient codices filled with stories of heroes and legends.
meanings.sent2: The historian studied the codices to learn about the culture of the past civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The codices whispered tales of adventure and mystery to those who dared to read them.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet room, the codices seemed to hold the secrets of the universe within their pages.
meanings.sent5: The fragile codices were like time capsules preserving the wisdom of bygone eras.

meanings.definition: A collection of manuscripts, especially of a specific author or genre.
meanings.sent1: The museum proudly displayed a collection of codices written by famous poets.
meanings.sent2: Scholars gathered to analyze the codices and unravel the mysteries they contained.
meanings.sent3: The codices in the archive seemed to have a lively conversation among themselves.
meanings.sent4: The shelves were filled with codices, each one a treasure trove of knowledge and creativity.
meanings.sent5: The codices in the library formed a colorful mosaic of literary achievements.
